verbose_text: Racemic 3-hydroxy-1,3-diphenylpropan-1-one was synthesized through beta borylation and deprotection by using a copper (II) complex containing L1 as the ligand, and it was used as a standard substrate for the screening of different biocatalysts.11 All reactions were performed in the presence of glucose (50 g L -1) as a co-substrate with a substrate concentration of 2 g L -1 in phosphate buffer, and the biotransformation results were evaluated after 48 h.
evidence: 3-hydroxy-1,3-diphenylpropan-1-one was synthesized through beta-borylation and deprotection by using a copper
